Description: Floor and flaring foot of South Ionian pottery cup, probably a cup with everted rim; interior: glazed black with concentric added red and white bands; exterior glazed; reserved on underside of foot and bowl; inscription on underside.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian cup type A1
Curator's comments: The decorative pattern suggests that the sherd may belong to a South Ionian cup belonging in Schlotzhauer's (Schlotzhauer 2012) Type 8.Bg group. These cups are amongst the stylistically oldest South Ionian cups with everted rims at Naukratis. For parallels, see British Museum 1886,0401.129.
Bibliographic references: Johnston 2006a / Trademarks on Greek Vases: Addenda (East Greek 226)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.072) (Phase 3)
